author: TonyFielding-Raby
title: The Perfect Base
text:
Just spent 3 extremely comfortable nights in this family run B&B hotel. I booked a single, en-suite room: it was nicely appointed, extremely clean and well maintained and the en-suite toilet / shower glistened as new. Complimentary soap and shampoo were provided plus the usual tea / coffee making facilities. My only tiny whinge was that the way the tap was configured in the basin made filling the kettle a bit difficult!.
The English breakfast with toast and tea or coffee or chocolate was excellent.
The hotel's location - just across the road from Kings Cross Station - was perfect for my whistle stop visit to London and, after a tough day wearing our the pavements the comfy bed was a joy to fall into!
Also, the price was excellent. I paid £299 for three nights including breakfast. The nearest Travellodge would have cost me £75 more - that's a West End Show and a reasonable meal!
And the staff were warm, welcoming, friendly and helpful. I shall certainly stay there again.
Room Tip: There is no lift. I walk using crutches so booked a ground floor room - but there are stairs to nego... See more room tips
